title: How Many Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a lb of ground beef (80/20 lean), plus protein, fat, full nutrition facts per 100 g, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef?
assumptions: 80% lean / 20% fat, raw, no added seasonings or fillers; 1 lb ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat percentage, brand, exact leanness, and cooking method (e.g., draining fat reduces calories). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pound of 80/20 ground beef has about 1153 calories and 78 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a lb of 80/20 ground beef?
Is this for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Raw weight; cooking and draining can reduce calories by 20-40% due to fat loss.

faqs.q: How much protein in a pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: About 78 g protein in 1 lb of 80/20 ground beef.

faqs.q: What affects calories in ground beef most?
faqs.a: Fat content—leaner (90/10) has fewer calories (~800 per lb) vs. fattier (70/30) with more.

faqs.q: Does cooking change the calorie count for ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes, broiling/draining lowers it per original weight; cooked yield is ~75% of raw weight.
